intro: Phacelia brachyantha var. paniculata, commonly known as the panicled phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to attract pollinators and stabilize soil.
